title: bushfireApp
text: bushfireApp R package bundles: - cleaned dataset annual temperature anomalies (relative 1861–1890 baseline), - interactive Shiny App explore dataset, - reproducible documentation reproducible research. goal let users see global (regional) temperatures shifted time relative “pre-industrial” baseline.

title: bushfireApp
text: Explore full package documentation Shiny demo :https://ETC5523-2025.github.io/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-yluu0123/

what: then install this package from GitHub
title: bushfireApp
Launch the Shiny app — run_my_app
text: Opens interactive temperature anomaly explorer. app lets : Filter country (e.g. World, Australia) Choose year range View time series plot temperature anomaly Inspect underlying data table

title: Launch the Shiny app — run_my_app
text: return value. function called side effect launching Shiny app.

title: Global temperature anomaly data (OWID) — temp_data
text: Annual mean near-surface temperature anomaly (°C) relative 1861–1890 baseline. subset (e.g., Australia World) included use package Shiny app.

title: Global temperature anomaly data (OWID) — temp_data
text: data frame columns: country Character. Entity name (e.g., "Australia", "World"). year Integer. Observation year. temp_anomaly Numeric. Temperature anomaly °C relative 1861–1890.

title: Global temperature anomaly data (OWID) — temp_data
text: World Data, “Annual temperature anomalies relative pre-industrial period” (Met Office Hadley Centre – HadCRUT5). https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/temperature-anomaly

title: Global temperature anomaly data (OWID) — temp_data
text: dataset prepared OWID “temperature-anomaly” CSV data-raw/ using data-raw/build_data.R. cleaned object saved data/temp_data.rda exposed temp_data.
